member.name: T:System.AggregateException
member.summary: Represents one or more errors that occur during application execution.
member.remarks: is used to consolidate multiple failures into a single, throwable exception object.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Exception})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with references to the inner exceptions that are the cause of this exception.
member.param: The exceptions that are the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor(System.Exception[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with references to the inner exceptions that are the cause of this exception.
member.param: The exceptions that are the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Exception})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and references to the inner exceptions that are the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exceptions that are the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and references to the inner exceptions that are the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exceptions that are the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Exception})
member.summary: Allocates a new aggregate exception with the specified message and list of inner exceptions.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exceptions that are the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.GetBaseException
member.summary: Returns the that is the root cause of this exception.

member.name: P:System.AggregateException.InnerExceptions
member.summary: Gets a read-only collection of the instances that caused the current exception.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.Handle(System.Func{System.Exception,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Invokes a handler on each contained by this .
member.param: The predicate to execute for each exception. The predicate accepts as an argument the to be processed and returns a Boolean to indicate whether the exception was handled.
member.remarks: Each invocation of the returns true or false to indicate whether the was handled. After all invocations, if any exceptions went unhandled, all unhandled exceptions will be put into a new which will be thrown. Otherwise, the method simply returns. If any invocations of the throws an exception, it will halt the processing of any more exceptions and immediately propagate the thrown exception as-is.
member.exception: An exception contained by this was not handled.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.Flatten
member.summary: Flattens an instances into a single, new instance.
member.returns: A new, flattened .
member.remarks: If any inner exceptions are themselves instances of , this method will recursively flatten all of them. The inner exceptions returned in the new will be the union of all of the the inner exceptions from exception tree rooted at the provided instance.

member.name: M:System.AggregateException.ToString
member.summary: Creates and returns a string representation of the current .
member.returns: A string representation of the current exception.

member.name: P:System.AggregateException.InnerExceptionCount
member.summary:
This helper property is used by the DebuggerDisplay.
Note that we don't want to remove this property and change the debugger display to {InnerExceptions.Count} because DebuggerDisplay should be a single property access or parameterless method call, so that the debugger can use a fast path without using the expression evaluator.
See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/x810d419.aspx

member.name: T:System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback
member.summary: Represents a method to be called when a message is to be dispatched to a synchronization context.
member.param: The object passed to the delegate.

member.name: T:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext
member.summary: Provides the basic functionality for propagating a synchronization context in various synchronization models.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of class.

member.name: P:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Current
member.summary: Gets the synchronization context for the current thread.

member.summary: Sets the current synchronization context.
member.param: The object to be set.

member.name: M:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Send(System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, dispatches a synchronous message to a synchronization context.
member.param: The delegate to call.
The object passed to the delegate.

member.name: M:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Post(System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, dispatches an asynchronous message to a synchronization context.
member.param: The delegate to call.
The object passed to the delegate.

member.name: M:System.Threading.SynchronizationContext.CreateCopy
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, creates a copy of the synchronization context.
member.returns: A new object.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1
member.summary: Represents an asynchronous operation that produces a result at some time in the future.
member.typeparam: The type of the result produced by this .

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1.Result
member.summary: Gets the result value of this .
member.remarks: The get accessor for this property ensures that the asynchronous operation is complete before returning. Once the result of the computation is available, it is stored and will be returned immediately on later calls to .
member.exception: An exception was thrown during the execution of the .

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Task.CompletedTask
member.summary: Gets a task that's already been completed successfully.
member.remarks: May not always return the same instance.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Exception
member.summary: Gets the Exception that caused the Task to end prematurely. If the Task completed successfully or has not yet thrown any exceptions, this will return null.
member.remarks: Tasks that throw unhandled exceptions store the resulting exception and propagate it wrapped in a in calls to Wait or in accesses to the property. Any exceptions not observed by the time the Task instance is garbage collected will be propagated on the finalizer thread.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Id
member.summary: Gets a unique ID for this Task instance.
member.remarks: Task IDs are assigned on-demand and do not necessarily represent the order in the which Task instances were created.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Task.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets whether this Task has completed.
member.remarks: will return true when the Task is in one of the three final states: RanToCompletion, Faulted, or Canceled.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Task.IsFaulted
member.summary: Gets whether the completed due to an unhandled exception.
member.remarks: If is true, the Task's will be equal to TaskStatus.Faulted, and its property will be non-null.

member.summary: Provides access to factory methods for creating and instances.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ContinueWith(System.Action{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a continuation that executes when the target completes.
member.param: An action to run when the completes. When run, the delegate will be passed the completed task as an argument.
member.returns: A new continuation .
member.remarks: The returned will not be scheduled for execution until the current task has completed, whether it completes due to running to completion successfully, faulting due to an unhandled exception, or exiting out early due to being canceled.

An object representing data to be used by the continuation action.
member.returns: A new continuation .
member.remarks: The returned will not be scheduled for execution until the current task has completed, whether it completes due to running to completion successfully, faulting due to an unhandled exception, or exiting out early due to being canceled.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus
member.summary: Represents the current stage in the lifecycle of a .

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Created
member.summary: The task has been initialized but has not yet been scheduled.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.WaitingForActivation
member.summary: The task is waiting to be activated and scheduled internally by the .NET Framework infrastructure.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.WaitingToRun
member.summary: The task has been scheduled for execution but has not yet begun executing.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Running
member.summary: The task is running but has not yet completed.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.WaitingForChildrenToComplete
member.summary: The task has finished executing and is implicitly waiting for attached child tasks to complete.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.RanToCompletion
member.summary: The task completed execution successfully.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Canceled
member.summary: The task acknowledged cancellation by throwing an OperationCanceledException with its own CancellationToken while the token was in signaled state, or the task's CancellationToken was already signaled before the task started executing.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Faulted
member.summary: The task completed due to an unhandled exception.

member.name: T:System.Threading.SpinWait
member.summary: Provides support for spin-based waiting.

remarks.para: encapsulates common spinning logic. On single-processor machines, yields are always used instead of busy waits, and on computers with Intel processors employing Hyper-Threading technology, it helps to prevent hardware thread starvation. SpinWait encapsulates a good mixture of spinning and true yielding.

is a value type, which means that low-level code can utilize SpinWait without fear of unnecessary allocation overheads. SpinWait is not generally useful for ordinary applications. In most cases, you should use the synchronization classes provided by the .NET Framework, such as . For most purposes where spin waiting is required, however, the type should be preferred over the method.

While SpinWait is designed to be used in concurrent applications, it is not designed to be used from multiple threads concurrently. SpinWait's members are not thread-safe. If multiple threads must spin, each should use its own instance of SpinWait.

member.name: P:System.Threading.SpinWait.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of times has been called on this instance.

member.name: P:System.Threading.SpinWait.NextSpinWillYield
member.summary: Gets whether the next call to will yield the processor, triggering a forced context switch.
member.value: Whether the next call to will yield the processor, triggering a forced context switch.
member.remarks: On a single-CPU machine, always yields the processor. On machines with multiple CPUs, may yield after an unspecified number of calls.

member.name: M:System.Threading.SpinWait.SpinOnce
member.summary: Performs a single spin.
member.remarks: This is typically called in a loop, and may change in behavior based on the number of times a has been called thus far on this instance.

member.name: M:System.Threading.SpinWait.Reset
member.summary: Resets the spin counter.
member.remarks: This makes and behave as though no calls to had been issued on this instance. If a instance is reused many times, it may be useful to reset it to avoid yielding too soon.

member.name: M:System.Threading.SpinWait.SpinUntil(System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Spins until the specified condition is satisfied.
member.param: A delegate to be executed over and over until it returns true.

member.name: M:System.Threading.SpinWait.SpinUntil(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Spins until the specified condition is satisfied or until the specified timeout is expired.
member.param: A delegate to be executed over and over until it returns true.
A that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
member.returns: True if the condition is satisfied within the timeout; otherwise, false
member.exception: is a negative number other than -1 milliseconds, which represents an infinite time-out -or- timeout is greater than .

member.name: M:System.Threading.SpinWait.SpinUntil(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Int32)
member.summary: Spins until the specified condition is satisfied or until the specified timeout is expired.
member.param: A delegate to be executed over and over until it returns true.
The number of milliseconds to wait, or (-1) to wait indefinitely.
member.returns: True if the condition is satisfied within the timeout; otherwise, false
member.exception: is a negative number other than -1, which represents an infinite time-out.

member.name: T:System.Threading.TimeoutHelper
member.summary: A helper class to capture a start time using Environment.TickCout as a time in milliseconds, also updates a given timeout bu subtracting the current time from the start time

member.name: M:System.Threading.TimeoutHelper.GetTime
member.summary: Returns the Environment.TickCount as a start time in milliseconds as a uint, TickCount tools over from postive to negative every ~ 25 days then ~25 days to back to positive again, uint is sued to ignore the sign and double the range to 50 days

member.name: M:System.Threading.TimeoutHelper.UpdateTimeOut(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Helper function to measure and update the elapsed time
member.param: The first time (in milliseconds) observed when the wait started
The orginal wait timeoutout in milliseconds
member.returns: The new wait time in milliseconds, -1 if the time expired
